title: 2 Nephi 23
html:
Farewell to Babylon

Synopsis: Destruction of Babylon is a type of destruction at Second Coming—It shall be a day of wrath and vengeance—Babylon (the world) shall fall forever—Compare Isaiah 13.

Who Is Our Guide?

Nephi continues as our guide because he "delighteth in proving unto [his] people the truth of the coming of Christ . . . and also [his] soul delighteth in the covenants of the Lord" (2 Nephi 11:4–5).

What Are the Trees?

  • Covenant Israel (modern covenant Israel is warned of the fall of the wicked in the last days)
  • Christ (the day of the Lord is described)
  • Current Events (the fall of the ancient kingdom of Babylon)
  • Coming Events (the fall of modern spiritual Babylon)

What Keys Can We Use?

  • Learn the Manner of Prophesying (Isaiah prophesies of the destruction of Babylon while also describing the destruction of spiritual Babylon before the Second Coming. Isaiah uses many similies and symbols: flames, gold, a chased roe, satyrs, and dragons)
  • Have the Spirit of Prophecy (read prayerfully)
  • Know the Regions Round About (understanding the ancient glory of Babylon makes this chapter more meaningful)
  • Live in the Last Days (modern scholars have written about the wonders of ancient Babylon. We also benefit from the footnotes in Isaiah 13 and information in the Bible Dictionary)

Overview of 2 Nephi 23 in One Paragraph

The Lord will call his forces, and Babylon will be destroyed. This prophecy is also foretelling events in the last days before the Second Coming of Christ.

Dividing the Tree of 2 Nephi 23 into Branches

  • 1–5: The Lord gathers his forces
  • 6–13: The Lord brings his power against (spiritual) Babylon
  • 14–22: The Lord brings the Medes against (physical) Babylon
